info.title: Botmaker API
info.description:
The Botmaker API enables you to: - start a WhatsApp conversation by sending a template message - trigger intents and send messages to open conversations - download messages from chats - download chats state (tags and variables) - manage agents and roles - manage WhatsApp account and templates - inspect WhatsApp conversations to know which were billed - start calls - and much more! #### Try it! You can test the endpoints by entering your `access-token` in the text box to the right.
Or you can download the [Postman Collection](https://storage.googleapis.com/botmaker/api/botmaker_api_v2.postman_collection). You only need to configure the [collection vars](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/#defining-collection-variables) `token`, `channelId` and `contactId` with your own values.

externalDocs.description: A Postman Collection. You need to setup the [collection vars](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/#defining-collection-variables) `token`, `channelId` and `contactId`.

tags.name: chats
tags.description: Know and modify chats state (variables and tags)

tags.name: chats actions
tags.description:
Send templates, messages, trigger intents.
You can also assign to agent, mute bot, and more

tags.name: messages
tags.description: Download messages history.

tags.name: channels
tags.description: Get chat channels ids (other endpoints need this data)

tags.name: agents
tags.description: Add or remove agents to attend chats.< br/>Logout absent agents

tags.name: roles
tags.description: Create, edit and delete agent roles

tags.name: calls
tags.description: List and start calls

tags.name: billing
tags.description: Inspect consumptions

tags.name: whatsapp accounts
tags.description: Start account creation process. Know line status and quality

tags.name: whatsapp templates
tags.description: Create, list and delete templates.

tags.name: whatsapp products
tags.description: Send products via whatsapp.

tags.name: ecommerce/catalogs
tags.description: Build a catalog of your products and offer them via WhatsApp and Google Business Messages.

tags.name: ecommerce/categories
tags.description: Upload your categories and organize them.

tags.name: ecommerce/products
tags.description: Upload your products and organize them with categories.

tags.name: ecommerce/stores
tags.description: Upload your inventory and organize them with stores.

tags.name: ecommerce/zones
tags.description: Upload your zones and organize them.

tags.name: ecommerce/price-schemas
tags.description: Upload your price schemas and organize them.

tags.name: intents
tags.description: List, create or update intents

tags.name: audits
tags.description: Find when and who changed an entity of your project.

tags.name: webhooks
tags.description: Manage your webhooks. Redirect webhooks for certain users

tags.name: bot config
tags.description: Configure bot variables and constants

get.description: List all agents with access to the bot.

parameters.name: online
parameters.description: Filter online agents with `true`. Use `false` to filter the offline users.

parameters.name: emails
parameters.description: Fetch agents by email. A list of emails can be used, separated by comma or repeating the `emails` query param.

post.description: Creates an agent.

201.description: The id of the created agent.

post.description: Logs out an agent from Botmaker.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The agent id on botmaker. You can get it from `/agents?emails=agent.name@exampleorg.com`.

delete.description: Disallows the agent to access to bot.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The agent id on botmaker. You can get it from `/agents?emails=agent.name@exampleorg.com`.

200.description: A list of the remaining bots the agent can access.

403.description: Can't modify agent with provided access-token.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The agent id on botmaker. You can get it from `/agents?emails=agent.name@exampleorg.com`.

403.description: Missing permissions to modify password (if no password change was intented, don't send password field).

get.description:
Search and see changes of your project.
**This endpoint will increase your BI data sources costs, so use it with care (save the response to avoid retrieving the same period every time).**

parameters.name: auditSection
parameters.description: The audit section to inspect.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Min change datetime. Defaults to start of month.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Max change datetime. Defaults to `now()`.

parameters.name: authors
parameters.description: The ids or emails of the agents that changed the entity, separated by commas.

parameters.name: authors-roles
parameters.description: The role ids of the agents that made the change, separated by commas. It can be a predefined role or a custom role id or name.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: The type of change you are searching for. By default, every type of change is searched.

parameters.name: search-keyword
parameters.description: Keyword to search in audit. For example, the id of an intent, agent, queue, etc. that has changed.

429.description: Only one request per minute allowed.

get.description: List consumptions for a specific month

parameters.name: billing-period
parameters.description: Month for which consumptions will be retrieved

429.description: Only one request per month allowed.

get.description: List WhatsApp conversations with their billing info monthly

parameters.name: billingPeriod
parameters.description: Billed period

200.description: A page of conversationsEach response carries 2500 conversations max. You should keep fetching the next page of conversations while `nextPage` is not null.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description:
List calls by date. (To start a call, use /chats-actions/start-call)
You can inspect:
- all the calls in a given period (using `from` and `to`)
- the calls for a particular chat (using `chat-id` or `channel-id` together with `contact-id`)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Min call datetime. It not sent, it will default to one day before `to`. (Not required when searching a chat calls)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Max call datetime. The default is `now()`. (Not required when searching a chat calls)

parameters.name: channel-id
parameters.description: Required to fetch a chat's calls by contact id. You must also provide `contact-id` param.

parameters.name: contact-id
parameters.description: The chat id in the chat platform. You must also provide `channel-id` param.

parameters.name: chat-id
parameters.description: The id of the chat in Botmaker. (If you use this parameter, `channel-id` and `contact-id` won't be used).

200.description: A page of calls, sorted by creation time. Each response carries 250 calls max; if there are more calls, the next page *url* will be returned in `nextPage`.

post.description:
Connects the Botmaker catalog (`catalogId`) to a chat platform catalog (WhatsApp, Google Business Messages).
 You can provide an external Catalog Id that represents an existing catalog in the external platform.

get.description: List all catalogs.

200.description: A page of 250 catalogs. You should keep calling the `nextPageURL` until it comes `null`.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

post.description: Create a catalog.

201.description: The id of the new catalog.

400.description: Request is missing `title` or catalog already existed with that `title`.

get.description: List or search catalog products.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

parameters.name: categoryCode
parameters.description: Filter products by category.

post.description: Create or Update a catalog products.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

201.description: The products were successfully created or updated. Note that after you created/updated all the products you needed, you need to `POST /ecommerce/catalogs/{catalogId}/platform-integrations/{platformOrPlatformCatalogId}/sync` to publish the products to the platform the catalog is linked to.

get.description: List all stores.

post.description: Create or Update a stores inventory.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

201.description: The inventory stores were successfully created or updated.

get.description: List categories of a catalog.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

post.description: Create or Update catalog categories.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

400.description: Category is missing code or title.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: Gets the zones associated with `catalogId` catalog.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: id of the catalog.

post.description: Creates new zones or updates them. A zone is a geographic area with price overrides for product prices that includes a group of stores.

get.description: Get product data by SKU.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

delete.description: Delete a product by its SKU.

post.description: Delete products of specific catalog by list of skus, max size to delete is 50. Get Catalog ID from /ecommerce/catalogs.
Delete stores by list of stores codes.

delete.description: Disconnects the Botmaker catalog (`catalogId`) from a chat platform catalog.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

parameters.name: platformOrPlatformCatalogId
parameters.description: The catalog platform you want to sync with or the catalog id in that platform. You can get these at [/ecommerce/catalogs/{catalogId}](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/get-catalog).

get.description: Gets a list of zone by code. A zone is a geographic area with price overrides for product prices that includes a group of stores.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

delete.description: Delete zone by code. A zone is a geographic area with price overrides for product prices that includes a group of stores.

get.description: This endpoint returns a list of the price-schemas available for the specified catalog.The price schemas are an overwriting of the current prices of the products by zone.

post.summary: Create or Update new price schema
post.description: Create new price schema or Update an existing price schema. The price schemas are an overwriting of the current prices of the products by zone.

201.description: The products schemas were successfully created or updated.

get.description: This endpoint returns a list of the price-schemas available for the specified catalog and zone code.  The price schemas are an overwriting of the current prices of the products by zone

post.summary: Sync catalog with external catalog platform
post.description: Syncs a Catalog with an outgoing External Catalog. This will push all products to an external catalog such as Facebook Catalog in order to feed special ChatChannels like WhatsApp or Google Business Messages. Update is done async, it may take up to 5 minutes to reflect change.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: The botmaker catalog id. You can get it at [/ecommerce/catalogs](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/list-catalogs)

parameters.name: platformOrPlatformCatalogId
parameters.description: The catalog platform you want to sync with or the catalog id in that platform. You can get these at [/ecommerce/catalogs/{catalogId}](https://api.botmaker.com/v2/#/get-catalog).

202.description: A webhook id and url to track the outcome of the sync process.

404.description: Catalog or platform integration not found.

post.description: Delete list of zones (including the price schema if it has an empty array of attachedZoneCodes) based on the requested list of codes and matching them with the specific catalog. A zone is a geographic area with price overrides for product prices that includes a group of stores.

requestBody.description: The list of zone codes to delete.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Fetch channels from `platform` only.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Filter only active channels.

200.description: The channels of the bot project.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

patch.description: Toggle channel's active state. You can also change its name.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The channel id.

requestBody.description: The modifications to apply to the channel.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description:
Gets the state of a chat.
*Note: this endpoint searches chats whose last activity occurred less than 2 months ago. (To search older chats, use [search chats endpoint](list-search-chats)).*

parameters.name: chatReference
parameters.description:
One of:
- The `chatId` (You get the `chatId` from other endpoints of the api or from the url of a chat in Botmaker, e. g. go.botmaker.com/#/chat/{chatId})
- Concatenation of `channelId` + `:` + `contactId`. `channelId` can be one of those you get at [GET /channels](https://api.botmaker.com/v2.0/#/operations/getChannels) endpoint, a WhatsApp phone line, the recipient id (in Messenger, Workplace) or a Telegram token. In WhatsApp the `contactId` is the phone number.
- An external id (some bots load users from an organization's internal database, and each of these users has an id in that organization; this id is the externalId)

patch.description: Change chat variables, tags, name, email or country.

parameters.name: chatReference
parameters.description:
One of:
- The `chatId` (You get the `chatId` from other endpoints of the api or from the url of a chat in Botmaker, e. g. go.botmaker.com/#/chat/{chatId})
- Concatenation of `channelId` + `:` + `contactId`. `channelId` can be one of those you get at [GET /channels](https://api.botmaker.com/v2.0/#/operations/getChannels) endpoint, a WhatsApp phone line, the recipient id (in Messenger, Workplace) or a Telegram token. In WhatsApp the `contactId` is the phone number.
- An external id (some bots load users from an organization's internal database, and each of these users has an id in that organization; this id is the externalId)

requestBody.description: The changes to apply to the chat. Send only the fields you want to change, the rest can be omitted.

get.description:
With this endpoint you can:
- **list all the chats** states, ordered by the chat last activity time.
- **Search for a specific chat** state. You can search by `contact-id`, user's `name` and by `email`.
Each request returns a max of 250 chats elements and a `nextPage` url to get the next chats. You should keep calling this endpoint until `nextPage` returns null.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Filter chats with last activity greater than `from`. If not passed, it default to one day before `to`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Filter chats with last activity minor than `to`. If not passed, it default to `now()`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search chat by user first and last name (separated by ' ' or '-').

parameters.name: emails
parameters.description: Search chat by user's email. A comma separated list of emails is allowed.

parameters.name: channel-id
parameters.description: Filter chats from a particular channel. Also, this param is required if you're searching by `contact-id`.

parameters.name: contact-id
parameters.description: Search chat by user's contact (in WhatsApp, the user's phone number). You must also provide `channel-id` query param.

parameters.name: long-term-search
parameters.description: **This endpoint adds up bytes to your BI data sources consumptions. You must explicitly state you are aware of this by sending this param in `true`.**

parameters.name: only-users-never-talked
parameters.description: Only search chats with that never initiated a conversation (no session)

post.description:
Send a message to a channel and get the responses. The responses will be sent via webhook (asynchronously).
_Currently supported platforms: Whatsapp, Telegram, Messenger, Gbm, Webchat, Googlechat, Instagram_chat, Workplace, MS Teams._

requestBody.description: A chat reference and the user message to generate the response.

202.description: Request accepted, will be processed asynchronously and informed via webhook.

400.description: Chat reference or message body problem.

post.description:
Send messages to a chat.
_Currently supported platforms: Whatsapp, Telegram, Messenger, Gbm, Webchat, Googlechat, Instagram_chat, Workplace, MS Teams._

requestBody.description: A chat reference and the messages to send to it.

400.description: Chat reference or message body problem.

post.description: Creates a call, returning a list of links to join the call.

400.description: Chat reference or agent not found.

post.description: Triggers an intent or WhatsApp template in a chat.

400.description: Chat reference or message body problem.

post.description: Trigger intent in many (up to 500) chats. Use this endpoint to send WhatsApp templates.

202.description: An array of either a response id to track intent execution or an error.

post.description:
Checkout the current active cart for the specified contact.
If a Cart was found, this operation will close it, calculate the totals, and return its details.
If a Cart is not found for the user, this operation will return 404 NOT FOUND.
_Currently supported platforms: Whatsapp._

requestBody.description: A chat reference with an active cart in its state.

400.description: Chat reference or message body problem.

404.description: There is no active cart for the chat reference

post.description:
Send products to a given number.
If a cart is currently active/open, any products selected by the user will be appended.
_Currently supported platforms: Whatsapp._

requestBody.description: A chat reference and the messages to send to it.

400.description: Chat reference or message body problem.

post.description:
Will be removed on 31/07/2024. Change your API calls to use /chats-actions/commerce/send-products.
Send products to a given number.
_Currently supported platforms: Whatsapp._

requestBody.description: A chat reference and the messages to send to it.

400.description: Chat reference or message body problem.

202.description: Create reaction request was accepted. It will be processed asynchronously
Delete reaction request was accepted. It will be processed asynchronously

get.description: Get the constant.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Constant id on botmaker. You can check them on [constants page](https://go.botmaker.com/#/variables).

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Constant id on botmaker. You can check them on [constants page](https://go.botmaker.com/#/variables).

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: List all constants of this bot.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: Retrieve Agents Performance (as in Agent Performance page). By default, it retrieves today metrics.You can filter by: - Specific range of time - Specific group - Specific queue - Specific agent - Specific role **This endpoint will increase your BI data sources costs, so use it with care (save the response to avoid retrieving the same period every time).**

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Min datetime. It not sent, it will default to the last hour.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Max datetime. Requires "from"

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: A list of groups to filter with.

parameters.name: operatorsIds
parameters.description: A list of operators id to filter with.

parameters.name: rolesIds
parameters.description: A list of roles to filter with.

parameters.name: queues
parameters.description: A list of queues to filter with.

parameters.name: includeSubgroups
parameters.description: Include Subgroups.

200.description: A page of metrics, sorted by session creation time. Each response carries 5000 metrics max; if there are more metrics, the next page *url* will be returned in `nextPage`.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: List agents metrics by conversation (as in Agent Metrics page). By default, it retrieves today metrics.You can filter by: - Specific range of time - List of Channel IDs - List of Agent IDs - List of Queues - Agent Online Status - Session Status (open, closed, both) **This endpoint will increase your BI data sources costs, so use it with care (save the response to avoid retrieving the same period every time).**

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Min datetime. It not sent, it will default to the last hour.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Max datetime. Requires "from"

parameters.name: channel-ids
parameters.description: Required to filter metrics by channel id.

parameters.name: agent-ids
parameters.description: A list of agents id to filter with.

parameters.name: queues
parameters.description: A list of queues to filter with.

parameters.name: online-status
parameters.description: The operator online status to filter with

parameters.name: session-status
parameters.description: Filter metrics by session status

200.description: A page of metrics, sorted by session creation time. Each response carries 5000 metrics max; if there are more metrics, the next page *url* will be returned in `nextPage`.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: Gets entity by name

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: id or name of the entity.

post.description: Creates a new entity or updates an entity

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Entity name

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Entity name

parameters.name: idOrName
parameters.description: Id or name of the intent.

200.description: The intent with id or name.

get.description: List all intents. This helps to find out intents ids or names needed as param in `/chat-actions/trigger-intent`.

200.description: A page of 200 intents. You should keep calling the `nextPageURL` until it comes `null`.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.summary: Get temporary access link for private file
get.description:
Generates a temporal link to download a private file. The link will expire in `expire-minutes` minutes.
(Use this endpoint only if your project has restricted storage access enabled)

parameters.name: file-url
parameters.description: File private url

parameters.name: expire-minutes
parameters.description: The access link duration in minutes. Default is 3.

200.description: The temporary access link (with expire token)

get.description:
With this endpoint you can: - Get the **entire message history** from all chats. - Get the message history for **one particular chat**. To select a chat, use either `chatId` alone or both `channelId` and `contactId`.
To filter by datetime, use `from` and `to`.
**This endpoint will increase your BI data sources costs, so use it with care (save the response to avoid retrieving the same period every time).**

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Min message datetime. Defaults to:
- **1 day ago** for long-term searches.
- **3 days ago** for non long-term searches without chat or customer filters (maximum range for non long-term searches).
- **90 days ago** for non long-term searches with chat or customer filters (maximum range for non long-term searches).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
Max message datetime. Defaults to:
- **one hour ago** for long-term searches.
- **now** for non long-term searches

parameters.name: channel-id
parameters.description: Required to fetch a chat's messages by contact id. You must also provide `contact-id` param.

parameters.name: contact-id
parameters.description: The chat id in the chat platform. You must also provide `channel-id` param.

parameters.name: chat-id
parameters.description: The id of the chat in Botmaker. (If you use this parameter, `channel-id` and `contact-id` won't be used).

parameters.name: chat-platform
parameters.description: Retrieves messages sent in `chat-platform` only.

schema.description: **This endpoint adds up bytes to your BI data sources consumptions. You must explicitly state you are aware of this by sending this param in `true`.**

200.description: A page of messages, sorted by creation time. Each response carries 1000 messages max; if there are more messages, the next page *url* will be returned in `nextPage`.

get.description: Retrieve contacts from blacklist. The blacklist prevents notifications from being sent to certain telephone numbers.

200.description: A page of contacts in blacklist

post.description: Add one or more contacts to the notifications blacklist with a limit of 1000 contacts per request. The blacklist prevents notifications from being sent to certain telephone numbers.

requestBody.description: List of contacts to add in the blacklist.

204.description: Contacts have been added to blacklist successfully.

get.description: List all notification campaigns

200.description: A page of 250 notification campaigns. You should keep calling the `nextPageURL` until it comes `null`.

post.description: Creates a new notification campaign
Creates and send a new notification in a campaign or send to more contacts of an existing one

delete.description: Remove a contact from blacklist. The blacklist prevents notifications from being sent to certain telephone numbers.

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: The contact to remove from blacklist

204.description: Contacts has been removed to blacklist successfully.

get.description: List all custom roles.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

post.description: Create a custom role. First it checks the role exists by `name`; if it doesn't, it creates the role.

400.description: The role already exists or the body is invalid.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: Get custom role by id or name.

parameters.name: idOrName
parameters.description: The role id or the name. You can get it from `/roles`.

parameters.name: idOrName
parameters.description: The role id or the name. You can get it from `/roles`.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description:
List sessions in a period, sorted by start datetime. For each session, you can fetch its messages, final variables and events by passing `include-messages`, `include-variables`, `include-events`. Each one of these will increase your BI data sources costs.
**This endpoint will increase your BI data sources costs, so use it with care (save the response to avoid retrieving the same period every time).**

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Min session start datetime. If not sent, it will default to one day before `to`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Max session start datetime. When `include-open-sessions` is `false`, it defaults to `now()` minus one day; when `true`, it defaults to `now()`.

parameters.name: long-term-search
parameters.description: **This endpoint adds up bytes to your BI data sources consumptions. You must explicitly state you are aware of this by sending this param in `true`.**

parameters.name: include-open-sessions
parameters.description: By default, only finished sessions are returned. If you also need ongoing sessions, send this param in `true`.

parameters.name: include-messages
parameters.description: Passing `true` will retrieve each session's messages.

parameters.name: include-variables
parameters.description: Passing `true` will retrieve each session's final variable state.

parameters.name: include-events
parameters.description: Passing `true` will retrieve each session's events.

parameters.name: timestamp-precision
parameters.description: Select timestamp precision ( seconds | milliseconds )

200.description: A page of sessions, sorted by creation time. Each response carries 500 sessions max; if there are more sessions, the next page *url* will be returned in `nextPage`.

parameters.name: agent-email
parameters.description: Filter typfications by agent email.

parameters.name: queue
parameters.description: Filter typfications by queue.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

parameters.name: onlyTags
parameters.description: Filter only tags variables.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

post.description: Redirection rules help testing a webhook being developed. They consist in the dev `URL` and a list of users (`chatsMatchProps`) to which the redirection applies. The messages from `chatsMatchProps` will be notified using the redirection rule's `URL`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The webhook id. You can get it from `/webhooks`.

get.description: Get webhook redirection rule.

parameters.name: webhookId
parameters.description: The webhook id. You can get it from `/webhooks`.

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The redirection rule id. You can get it from `/webhooks` or `/webhooks/{id}`.

parameters.name: webhookId
parameters.description: The webhook id. You can get it from `/webhooks`.

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The redirection rule id. You can get it from `/webhooks` or `/webhooks/{id}`.

patch.description: Redirection rules help testing a webhook being developed. They consist in the dev `URL` and a list of users (`chatsMatchProps`) to which the redirection applies. The messages from `chatsMatchProps` will be notified using the redirection rule's `URL`.

parameters.name: webhookId
parameters.description: The webhook id. You can get it from `/webhooks`.

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The redirection rule id. You can get it from `/webhooks` or `/webhooks/{id}`.

requestBody.description: You can change the `URL`, `name` or `chats` of a rule.

get.description: Get webhook by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The webhook id. You can get it from `/webhooks`.

get.description: List all webhooks.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: List whatsapp accounts.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

post.description: This endpoint will create a temporary invitation link that can be shared with a customer. The client can then use that link to access the Onboarding Flow, create Business Manager (or select an existing one), and then register a new WhatsApp Number. If the number passes successfully Meta's approval stage, then it will be connected automatically to Botmaker.

requestBody.description: The number of the WhatsApp account

201.description: An invitation link to the WhatsApp Onboarding Flow.

429.description: Only one request every 5 seconds allowed.

get.description: Get whatsapp account by Phone Number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The whatsapp number.

get.description: Get WhatsApp account status and details by Phone Number. Retrieve the general status, the name status, verification status, and the certificate status.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The whatsapp number

200.description: The WhatsApp phone number and its details.

429.description: Only one request every 5 seconds allowed.

get.description: List whatsapp templates.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Optional status to filter.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

post.description: Create a Whatsapp Template.

201.description: The WhatsApp template was successfully created.

429.description: Only one request per second allowed.

get.description: Get whatsapp template by id or name

parameters.name: idOrName
parameters.description: The whatsapp template id or name. You can get it from `/whatsapp/templates`.

delete.description: Delete Whatsapp Template by id or name

ChatReferenceReq.description:
Type union that identifies a chat; either
- `{ chatId }` or
- `{ channelId, contactId }`
(that is, you must use only `chatId` or both `channelId` and `contactId`).

channelId.description:
The id of the chat channel. It can be known at [GET /channels](https://api.botmaker.com/v2.0/#/operations/getChannels) endpoint. It also can be:
- a WhatsApp phone line number
- a recipient id (in Messenger, Workplace)
- a Telegram token

contactId.description: The id of the chat in the chat platform. In WhatsApp, it is the phone number.

chatId.description: The id of the chat in [Botmaker Chats](https://go.botmaker.com/#/chats), that is: https://go.botmaker.com/#/{chatId}.
The id of the chat in [Botmaker Chats](https://go.botmaker.com/#/chats), that is: https://go.botmaker.com/#/{chatId}.

channelId.description: The id of the chat channel.

contactId.description: The id of the chat in the chat platform. In WhatsApp, it is the phone number.

RolePermissions.description:
The permissions that an agent with this role has. Permissions allow an agent to access sections in Botmaker (chats, bots, templates, etc).
A permission in turn can have **actions**, that give more granular control over what actions can be performed on a section.

CatalogPlatform.description: Chat platform to connect a catalog with.

code.description: The id of the category in your business.

iconImageUrl.description: The URL of an imaged that will be used as icon of the category on the e-commerce web view

parentCategoryCode.description: It is used to create sub-categories. This is the code of the parent category.

order.description: The number to display the categories in ascending ordering

CatalogCategory.description:
A category organizes products into groups.
When creating, you must pass all required fields; when updating, only `code` is required.

code.description: The id of the zone in your business.

radius.description: The radius of the attention zone. Use either this or `zoneCoordinates`.

zoneCoordinates.description: A list of point that define the polygon that is attended by this zone. Use either this or `radius`.

excludedZoneCoordinates.description: A list of point that define the polygon that is *not* attended by this zone.

storeCodes.description: The stores that belong to the zone.

sku.description: The id of the product. It can be known at [GET /products] (https://api.botmaker.com/v2.0/commerce/catalogs/{catalogId}/products endpoint.

availability.description: The product availability inside of store. The possible values are IN_STOCK or OUT_OF_STOCK

InventoryReference.description:
This object describes a list of key-value pairs, where the key represents the product's SKU, and the value represents its availability (IN_STOCK or OUT_OF_STOCK).
- `{ sku: availability }`
- `Example: { "12345": "IN_STOCK" }`

items.description: Contact mail and phone number
Total with currency
product usage information
product usage information
project information

CustomFields.description: Custom fields that can be added to any ticket. Each customField is a map with the keys `fieldId` and `fieldValues`. Use the [GET /v2.0/tickets/field-definitions] endpoint to find them. The fieldId is the id of the field definition and the fieldValues are the selected values in the valid options array in the field definition resource.

Attachment.description: A list of attachments to be added to the ticket. Each attachment is a map with the keys `name` (ex: 'an image name.jpg') and `url` (ex: 'https://example.com/image.jpeg').

alias.description: A name used to prefix agent messages in a conversation.

role.description: The role of the operator. Either a default role (`ADMIN`, `CONFIGURATOR`, `SUPERVISOR`, `OPERATOR`) or a custom role name.

creationTime.description: The creation time of the operator

queues.description: The queues ids this agent receives conversations from.

items.description: The queues ids this agent receives conversations from.

slots.description: The amount of users an agent can attend at a given moment

lang.description: The language to use in Botmaker.

entityId.description: The id of the entity that was changed.

billingPeriod.description: The billing period in the format 'YYYY-MM'.

templateName.description: The name of the Whatsapp template sent

catalogId.description: The id of the catalog in the platform.

externalCatalogId.description: The catalog Id of the external platform

CatalogPlatformConnectRequest.description: The platform to connect the catalog to.

Option.description: Options define configurable attributes of a product (like color or size) and list the possible values a customer can choose from. This attribute is *only* meant for products in the Botmaker Ecommerce. If this attribute is present, the attribute variants can't be used.

sku.description: The id of the product in your business.

link.description: A link with a more detailed description about the product.

image.description: The main image of the product.

additionalImages.description: Other image details of the product.

items.description: Other image details of the product.

salePrice.description: An override of the current price.

salePriceAsString.description: An override of the current price.

salePeriods.description: A list of sales prices for a date range (startDate, endDate, salePrice).

inventory.description: An approximate of the stock count of the product.

categories.description: The category codes under which the product will be listed. You can get the codes at `GET /ecommerce/catalogs/{catalogId}/categories`

items.description: The category codes under which the product will be listed. You can get the codes at `GET /ecommerce/catalogs/{catalogId}/categories`

group.description: A string to group variants of the same product model into one display. *Only for Meta*.

order.description: The products are sorted in ASC order.

tags.description: Tags of product. These tags are used to filter on ecommerce website

items.description: Tags of product. These tags are used to filter on ecommerce website

variants.description: Variants are different versions of a product that share the same core identity but vary by attributes like size, color, or model. This attribute is *only* meant for products in the Botmaker Ecommerce. If this attribute is present, the attribute options can't be used.

options.description: Options define configurable attributes of a product (like color or size) and list the possible values a customer can choose from. This attribute is *only* meant for products in the Botmaker Ecommerce. If this attribute is present, the attribute variants can't be used.

products.description: When creating a product, respect all **required** fields. When updating, you must send the product `sku` (and only the properties you need to change).

salePrice.description: Sale price for a date range

code.description: The store code in your catalog

address.description: The store address in your catalog

stores.description: When creating a store, respect all **required** fields. When updating, you must send the list of inventory (and only the properties you need to change).

Any text.
Some platforms allow bolding surrounding text with '*' and italics surrounding with '_'.

CallParticipantLink.description: The links to join the conversation. Each link carries either the `agent` or `chat` to which the link should be assigned.

links.description: The links to join the conversation. Each link carries either the `agent` or `chat` to which the link should be assigned.

id.description: The id of the agent. You must send either this or `email`.

email.description: The agent's email. You must send either this or `id`.

name.description: The name that will be displayed in the call. This field is **optional**; If not passed, the agent's alias will be used.

avatarURL.description: The image that will be showed in the call. This field is **optional**; If not passed, the agent's picture configured in Botmaker will be used.

CallAgent.description: One or more agents that ... the conversation.

agents.description: One or more agents that ... the conversation.

intentIdOrName.description: The intent id or name. You can get the id at the `/intents` endpoint; the name is the one found at [Botmaker bots page](https://go.botmaker.com/#/bots).

additionalProperties.description: Variables to set before the intent execution starts.

variables.description: Variables to set before the intent execution starts.

postActionIntentIdOrName.description: An optional action that can be executed after the main intent. A intent id or name is expected. You can get the id at the `/intents` endpoint; the name is the one found at [Botmaker bots page](https://go.botmaker.com/#/bots).

TriggerIntentRequest.description: A chat reference and the intent to trigger.

catalogId.description: Id of the Botmaker catalog, must be connected to META catalog

skus.description: The SKUs that will be sent in the message. This SKUs must exist in the provided catalogId. The amount of products should be between 1 and 30 products max.

items.description: The SKUs that will be sent in the message. This SKUs must exist in the provided catalogId. The amount of products should be between 1 and 30 products max.

createNewCart.description: If true, a new cart will be created for the user and if there is an existing cart, it will be abandoned. By default, this behaviour is set to false, and carts are kept open until a checkout operation is performed by the ChatBot, by the Agent, or through an API call.

messageId.description: The unique identifier of the message to which you want to add a reaction. The messageId can be obtained using the List Messages API [GET /v2.0/messages](https://api.botmaker.com/v2.0/messages) by searching for the id values in the items array.

reaction.description: The emoji that represents the reaction. This should be a valid emoji string.

messageId.description: The unique identifier of the message to which you want to delete a reaction. The messageId can be obtained using the List Messages API [GET /v2.0/messages](https://api.botmaker.com/v2.0/messages) by searching for the id values in the items array.

id.description: The Botmaker id of the constant.

name.description: The Botmaker name of the constant.

type.description: The Botmaker type of the constant.

value.description: The Botmaker value of the constant.

visibleInUserInfo.description: If the variable is visible to agents in the chats section.

category.description: Category in which agents will be able to view the variable in the chats section.

icon.description: Icon with which agents can see the variable in the chats section.

tagColor.description: Color that the label will display in the chats section.

orderInUserInfo.description: Place it will occupy in the variable list in the chats section.

id.description: The id needed to interact with this API.

chatsMatchProps.description:
A list of chats properties to match against every chat.
Each element is a map to match with the properties of a chat; if a chat matches these properties, the messages from this chat will be sent to this redirection rule `URL` (instead of using the webhook's default URL).

additionalProperties.description:
A list of chats properties to match against every chat.
Each element is a map to match with the properties of a chat; if a chat matches these properties, the messages from this chat will be sent to this redirection rule `URL` (instead of using the webhook's default URL).

items.description:
A list of chats properties to match against every chat.
Each element is a map to match with the properties of a chat; if a chat matches these properties, the messages from this chat will be sent to this redirection rule `URL` (instead of using the webhook's default URL).

name.description: A name to help you identifying this object.

channelsIds.description: Which channels this webhook will notify messages from.

items.description: Which channels this webhook will notify messages from.

MessagesNotifications.description: Configuration about messages from whom are notified and whether to include variable changes.

id.description: The webhook id in Botmaker. To change a webhook via API, you need this id.

active.description: Only active webhooks will be notified.

token.description: Token sent in each notification in the `auth-bm-token` header.

id.description: The webhook id in Botmaker. To change a webhook via API, you need this id.

active.description: Only active webhooks will be notified.

token.description: Token sent in each notification in the `auth-bm-token` header.

redirectionRules.description: Alternate URLs to use for dev.

items.description: Alternate URLs to use for dev.

templateNamespace.description: This namespace is needed to send template messages.

text.description: The header text. (Only required when `format` is `TEXT`.)

exampleURL.description: An example file used by WhatsApp to decide whether or not to approve the template. (Only required when `format` is other than `TEXT`; needed to create template in `POST whatsapp/templates`.)

intentIdOrName.description:
The intent to execute when the button is pressed.
_Only for `QUICK_REPLY`._

webhookPayload.description:
Anything you want to receive via webhook when the button is pressed.
_Only for `QUICK_REPLY`; use only one of `webhookPayload` or `intentIdOrName`._

url.description:
The url to navigate when the button is pressed. It can have a variable postfix, e. g. `https://www.example.com/{botVarName}` (this postfix can be an user id).
_Only for `URL` type._

phoneNumber.description:
The phone number to call when the button is pressed.
_Only for `PHONE_NUMBER` type_.

WhatsAppTemplateButton.description:
The template buttons. WhatsApp buttons rules are:
- `QUICK_REPLY` cannot be combined with `URL` and `PHONE_NUMBER` buttons
- You can use 3 `QUICK_REPLY` buttons max
- Only one `URL` button and one `PHONE_NUMBER` are allowed; you can combine both of these types

notes.description: Problems that were found in WhatsApp template approval process.

additionalProperties.description: Problems that were found in WhatsApp template approval process.

items.description: Problems that were found in WhatsApp template approval process.

botName.description:
The bot this template will set when triggered.
Required for creation when your project has multiple bots.

optInImage.description: An example image showing that you ask the user for permission to send him/she whatsapp messages.

buttons.description:
The template buttons. WhatsApp buttons rules are:
- `QUICK_REPLY` cannot be combined with `URL` and `PHONE_NUMBER` buttons
- You can use 3 `QUICK_REPLY` buttons max
- Only one `URL` button and one `PHONE_NUMBER` are allowed; you can combine both of these types

phoneLineNumber.description:
One of your WhatsApp phone numbers. *Only required if you have more than one business account in WhatsApp*.
You can list them at [/channels?platform=whatsapp](list-channels).

botName.description:
The bot this template will set when triggered.
Required for creation when your project has multiple bots.

optInImage.description: An example image showing that you ask the user for permission to send him/she whatsapp messages.

buttons.description:
The template buttons. WhatsApp buttons rules are:
- `QUICK_REPLY` cannot be combined with `URL` and `PHONE_NUMBER` buttons
- You can use 3 `QUICK_REPLY` buttons max
- Only one `URL` button and one `PHONE_NUMBER` are allowed; you can combine both of these types

access-token.description: You can generate the `access-token` token at [Botmaker](https://go.botmaker.com/#/integrations/api "Botmaker API page").
access-token.name: access-token

bearer-token.description: Authentication used by agents connected to Botmaker (not usable by programs).
bearer-token.name: bearer-token
